website_summaries.verdict: A well-liked supplement with few negative reactions reported by owners, though bigger dogs will use up this bottle quickly due to dose size.
pros: Somewhat easy to administer, as gel capsules can be hidden in favorite food
Users note that dogs move better using supplements
cons: Some users report the recommended dosages are too low for larger dogs
Gels can clump together after being opened and in humid conditions

customer_reviews.title: The vet cardiologist says this is awesome! She gets an echocardiogram 3xs yr now since ...
customer_reviews.text: So far my rescue schnoodle is 11 yrs old with slight enlargement and murmur. Her cardiologist said if we cant get bpa free organic sardines then 3-5 of these daily will do. Shes had this murmur now and this being her only med for 4 yrs now but she takes this religiously. The vet cardiologist says this is awesome! She gets an echocardiogram 3xs yr now since she was also diagnosed with a pancreatic insulinoma. I began giving her an anticancer diet macrobiotics guided by a vet and it seems to have shrunk that lesion so far. All my pets live into their early 20s. We expect that with her and our other dogs as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fegettaboutit

customer_reviews.title: No Return Policy
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product in the past and was very happy with it and my dog did well with it. However, I ordered a new supply yesterday and it arrived today with all gel caps stuck together and not usable. Come to find out that this product cannot be returned for replacement. It must have been sitting somewhere in a warm place to arrive in this condition. This is inexcusable as I took the package in the moment it was delivered!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not use these soft gets if they arrive in a lump.  They should not be used.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two, both arrived clumped together and both were one big lump of soft gels melted together. Not fresh, or took too long to arrive and sat in delivery truck. These products can go rancid, and sicken your pet. Unfortunately, I didn't realized this, and had given my pet two bottles of same item which also arrived clumped in a lump. She became ill. When I got the second set of melted gels, I realized there was something wrong. I have been ordering these soft gels for many years without any problem, but maybe not from this manufacturer. So make sure when you order it is not warm out!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: FAKE!! Do not feed to your dog. Buy Nordic Naturals from their website or your vet.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT FEED THESE TO YOUR DOG!! FAKE!! These are not the real Nordic Natural brand. I noticed the packaging was different, the pill color is different but what scared me the most is the smell. REAL Nordic Natural Omega 3 capsules smell like FISH, these capsules do not smell like fish, they smell like chewable vitamin C. I believe whoever is packaging these are using bottles that once stored chewable vitamin C. I will be returning and reporting. I added a picture of the REAL Nordic Natural omega 3 capsules (top) and these fake capsules (bottom). Very different.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Levin

customer_reviews.title: My vet recommends this brand only
customer_reviews.text: My vet highly recommends this brand of fish oil and I trust him. My service dog deserves the best! She has been taking this daily for over a year and she has the shiniest coat imaginable and her arthritis has eased. UPDATE 3/20/2019. I had stopped giving my dog the fish oil, and her arthritis started acting up, she was limping after long hikes. It is AMAZING just how fast the fish oil helped her, and I am not much of a believer in miracle “cures”, but after 3 weeks of dosing her limp is MUCH LESS. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.author: LeighTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Either fake product or stale
customer_reviews.text: Received these today and when I compare them to the already-opened bottle that I have (purchased elsewhere), these don't even have the slightest hint of fish oil smell to them when the capsule is opened. Fish oil is supposed to smell fishy and these don't at all--leading me to believe that they are either fake or the product has gone stale. Not something I would risk feeding my dog so I threw them in the garbage and contacted amazon for my refund. Do yourself a favor and buy them from a reputable store!!!
customer_reviews.author: sillygirl

customer_reviews.title: 100% WORKS AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome I take the Nordic Naturals one for humans this stuff is absolutely amazing my dog has been acting completely like a spring pup her coat is shiny and beautiful that used to be very dull I've seen a complete turnaround in my dogs also I give my dog Natural Factors ubiquinol active Co q-10. Set with these two things together my vet has seen a complete difference in my Shih Tzu and Cavalier King Charles Spaniel
customer_reviews.author: l.I

customer_reviews.title: Eats them out of the bowl
customer_reviews.text: I've always felt fish supplements and anything else I can do for my pup to insure his health is something I like to start from the get go. These seem to go down very easy for him. I just pop them in his bowl in the morning with his food and some water mixed in to move the kibble flavor around and he doesn't even seem to notice they're there. If he does, then he likes the smell of fish!
customer_reviews.author: Chaotic Cate

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: These are great for limps and joint pain. Our dog was limping for months. After a few weeks of taking these along with Joint Health Support from Nutrition Strength the limp is gone. He loves the taste but give them at night because they smell fishy. It's worth it though.
customer_reviews.author: sonandmoon

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this omega-3 on her food!
customer_reviews.text: My dog prefers her food to be flavored with Nordic Naturals Omega-3 Pet Soft Gels. I take a sharp paring knife and poke a tiny hole at the end of a capsule and then slowly dribble the contents of the capsule over my dog's kibble. She eats all of the food. I only wish I could give it to her twice a day! An excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda52

customer_reviews.title: My dog hated it. Wouldn’t eat his food.
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my dog’s food based on his veterinarian’s recommendation of adding Omega 3 to his diet. He won’t touch his food even if I only use one capsule (should be 3 based on his weight) and even if I puncture it and pour it over his food. Now I have 177 tablets that will go in the garbage. Unfortunately a waste of $.
customer_reviews.author: M A

customer_reviews.title: pills all stuck together
customer_reviews.text: The gel pills were all stuck together in the bottle. I was able to get them apart, but it took about 1/2 hour. I then placed them in the fridge. I don't know that getting them in a mail order was the right thing to do. The price was good. My dog takes the pill in a pill pocket. Might look for a local source to get this item or check for human omega 3 pills.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit product??
customer_reviews.text: So, like another user, I noticed a difference from prior purchases. Pretty likely a counterfeit product; misspelling on label different from that purchased from another retailer. Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.author: docjholliday

customer_reviews.title: A softer coat in less than 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Our Vet recommended an omega-3 supplement ... as a Nutritionist I have always been happy with Nordic Naturals products. He said 4 pills daily would give us results in about a month. We gave our dog (Red Doberman) 2 pills a day and noticed a softer coat in a little over a week. For what it's worth, I think his stool is more solid - so this seems to help his fur and digestive system. We are very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Justin A. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: TOO LARGE
customer_reviews.text: I am sure the product is great its just they are too big. My beagle got choked on it this morning and thank God I was right there to get it out. I will have to look for smaller ones because I wll not be giving these to any of my dogs now and its a shame because I just bought them and only used 1 out of the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A.

customer_reviews.title: Not cost effective for dogs over 20 pounds
customer_reviews.text: My reason for using this was to help my dog with early arthritis and overall wellness. Not realizing until after the fact that my 54 pound dog would need 6 soft gels a day to reach the correct amount of EPA recommended. Dogs need 300mg of EPA per 20 pounds of body weight daily. Not cost effective for any dog over 20 pounds. My Veterinarian has told me I can purchase human omega 3 pills with more EPA per soft gel and that'll work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like what one of them was doing for him (very ...
customer_reviews.text: I started using these for our older dog (he's 14 1/2) that has a history of anxiety and has been on many different types of medications. I didn't like what one of them was doing for him (very sleepy, losing weight) so I researched other options. I have been using this product as an alternative to the medication I didn't like for him and he is doing very well with one capsule 2-3 times a day with a lower dose of a different medication. These have given us new hope for his anxiety and will hopefully help us to continue to keep him healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: 14 y.o. Cocker Spaniel Impressive Improvement!
customer_reviews.text: My baby seems to be coming around!! She’s greatly improved and I hope it continues. It’s only been a week and a half, but her pacing and panting and shaking have reduced dramatically. This will be a lifelong supplement for her from now on! Packing and shipping was fast and perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: sotasmom

customer_reviews.title: tamper seal was half way off
customer_reviews.text: The tamper-evident seal was not all the way on the bottle when I opened it. It was half way off already. Apparently this product is not returnable. This is the second time I've had a problem ordering this product. The first time it came it was human Omega-3 lemon flavor. This time the seal was broken and I had to give it to my dog anyway because she needed her dose that day.
customer_reviews.author: Abby L. Mayr

customer_reviews.title: did exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: our dog's breed is known for developing skin allergies/dryness as they age. just needed some omega-3. saw radical improvement after 2 days. her skin is 90% better than before. she's barely scratches any and has only been on this stuff for a few weeks. Edit: After now a few months we're at 100% skin clearance. The vet didn't even think about this as a solution, changed vets after this...
customer_reviews.author: Maegan

customer_reviews.title: Dog hates them.
customer_reviews.text: THEY DON'T ALLOW RETURNS. I just tried to return it . The dosage is high so you're better off purchasing liquid form, my dog is 90 lbs and needs 4 softgels. I figured I'd give them a try anyways but my dogs hate it , i typically pour it over their food and they devour it. I had to throw the dog food away because they won't eat it now.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina S.

customer_reviews.title: Prescribed by Vet, Much Cheaper on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The vet prescribed these exact pills, and covered the label with the Rx information. So, I scraped his sticker off, and found the identical pills on Amazon for about $20 saving. I can't say these pills are a better supplement than others, but the vet chose these. Who am I to argue?
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Works great and helps my dog.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this fish oil for about two months on my dog. I add the oil from one capsule to her evening meal. My veterinarian recommended I give this to my dog, in addition to vegan dog food to help my dog combat fatty blood with high protein levels. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: JAMM

customer_reviews.title: Did not help my dog.
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog with a chronic skin condition. When he is on Omega 3 supplements, his skin is clearer, and his coat is softer and shinier. These supplements did not help him at all, in fact his skin got slightly worse while taking them.
customer_reviews.author: MoreCoffee

customer_reviews.title: Vet recommended supplement
customer_reviews.text: Our holistic vet prescribed the Nordic Natural Omega 3 Pet fish oil for our Weim. The oil can be quite smelly and so I alternate with the gels as there is no odor when preparing to add to her meals. I needed to contact Nordic Naturals on an issue and they were most professional & helpful in resolving the problem. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This product works!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended to me by the veterinarian because my son (dog) gets extremely dry skin in the winter. During the winter his coat looks dull, flaky skin, and he scratches uncontrollably. Since purchasing this product and putting in his food once a day his coat remained shiny during the winter and very minimum scratching. He’s a smaller dog so I pierce the casting and drizzle the oil over his food each morning. He loves it and so do I! I will continue to order.
customer_reviews.author: Akea

customer_reviews.title: Made dog vomit
customer_reviews.text: My 20-pound dog refused to swallow the capsules because they are so large, even when trying to hide in a treat or food. I punctured the pill and drizzled the oil over his food once a day. Each time would make him vomit after about 15 minutes. I stopped giving him the pill and he stopped vomiting. I thought maybe he wasn’t feeling well so I attempted this two weeks later, he threw up again. Whole bottle is going in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: average reader

customer_reviews.title: Big Pills for a Little Dog
customer_reviews.text: These are for my special doggie girl. I want her to have the meds but they are so big for a little dog. I put them in her food and sometimes she leaves it in her bowl. She hasn’t complained about the taste.
customer_reviews.author: susieshopper

customer_reviews.title: Fresh product
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes my dog doesn't love the texture, so I can easily slice it open and dribble over her food. Mostly I just drop it on top of her bowl and she gobbles it right down. The product is fresh and the gel capsules are soft, just as they should be. She's getting older, so it's a very good supplement for her coat. I always buy this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Megan'sMom

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure they're doing plenty of good for him internally as well
customer_reviews.text: My Black Lab has been on these soft gels for about a month now and I was hesitant that they'd work but he has the softest coat out of any dog I know. People including my vet can't stop giving compliments on how soft and shiny it is now. He also had dandruff before which is totally gone now! I'm sure they're doing plenty of good for him internally as well. I strongly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caplets vs. Liquid
customer_reviews.text: We have an issue with our GSD with itching/scratching, and while attempting to determine a cause (not fleas, mites, etc), we are using this product. We switched from caplets to liquid because we would hide the caplets in food, they would rupture the caplet and drop on floor. Vitamin liquid went on the floor, not into our pup. So, we switched to the liquid supplement and solved that issue.
customer_reviews.author: george4

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Coat
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my dog and she takes them like a treat so they must taste good. When I adopted my dog her hair was dull and after just three months her hair is looking healthy and shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Seems to help with my dogs arthritis
customer_reviews.text: I have a young dog with juvenile arthritis. We have been using this product for a few months, and it seems to help him with his shoulders. His skin and coat look and feel fabulous as well!
customer_reviews.author: Nikohl-M

customer_reviews.title: My vet recommended these for my golden who has genetically bad hips
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended these for my golden who has genetically bad hips. With the help of these, Monthly hip shots we administer ourselves and hemp oil our 8 year old is doing great! He was recommended to have a full hip replacement at 1 year old followed by months of therapy. We chose this route instead for as long as he stayed active and happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped with hair loss and itching on my dog
customer_reviews.text: My sharpei was constantly scratching and losing her fur. She has been on a monthly allergy shot from the vet, which helped some, but did not help her fur to grow back. I started her on this supplement and I kid you not her fur has grown back with in a month and the itching/scratching has ceased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My furry child loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My small dog loves this and licks it down like a treat! His coat seems to be doing better and eyes look clearer already... I will continue to give these to him. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Mikey P & Nana

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Soft gels were not soft and quite hard and all the pills were all clumped together upon arrival. Expiration date was 2019. Disappointed. This is my second attempt to post this review as the first one never showed up.
customer_reviews.author: Annabar

customer_reviews.title: Just what our spaniel needed for a healthy coat.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for our spaniel. We hide the pill in a pill pockets and our pup swallows it easily. Pet coat much shinier since using this. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: I received a new bottle of this fish oil and all the soft gels were stuck together. It seems like it was possibly exposed to heat. I could not separate them. It was a total waste. Hopefully if I order them in the future, someone will make sure that they are sending a good batch.
customer_reviews.author: Genuine Feedbac

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for several years for my dog to get him the fish oil he needs. I know this company puts out a high quality product. I just jab a small hole in it and squirt it in his meal. It keeps his coat shiny and no dry skin.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl P

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been taking this for about 2 years now. We started it, because the vet thought it would be good for his brittle fur and nails. He wasn't vitamin deficient and adding the fish oil is the only thing the vet could think of that we hadn't tried. A year later, people are constantly stopping to ask what I do to my dog's fur. It's thick and silky. His blood tests are all good, too. I'm glad we started him on it and we intend to continue it. I don't know if another brand of fish oil would work just as well, but this one has given us amazing results.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Vet recommended!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old German Shepherd takes 5 of these a day. He is still going strong. I don't know if it is because of this product or not, but I won't stop giving them to him! My dog's surgeon recommended these after my dog had a ligament repaired. The only conis that you have to give one pill for every 20 lbs. He's between 90-100 lbs so I give him 5, two in the morning and three at night. My dog doesn't like them so I have to wrap them in lunch meat. Sometimes he finds them and spits them out.
customer_reviews.author: T. Pizzity

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dog. She has bad allergies and skin issues. Her coat is looking a little better. Shipping was fast and had a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline  Flowers

customer_reviews.title: They lie about the quantity. It's about 60 pills, not 90.
customer_reviews.text: False advertising - NOT 90 pills. More like 60. My order history shows that order this product every 2 months (over the last 2 years). But .... I give 1 pill/day to my dog which means ordering after using 60 pills (or 2 months). Not 90, which would be every 3 months. (I always reorder when the bottle is very close to empty.) I'm not ordering this product anymore as they are lying about the quantity. If they lie about this, what else are they lying about?
customer_reviews.author: Adam Galblum

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: Brand was recommended by our vet even. However, by day 3 of using the fish oil as directed for my 14lb dog, he's been super sick. Throwing up all over and the smell of the throw up WOW it smells like death. Went poop at 1:30 am (when I was changing the sheets on my bed because he threw up) which is totally out of the normal for him. Today is day 4 and he wouln't get off the couch, except when he threw up on it. Discontinuing use immediately. Pretty disappointed in the strict no return policy considering it made him sick. Big fat waste of $35.
customer_reviews.author: charles arterburn

customer_reviews.title: The only brand I will use for my dog and ...
customer_reviews.text: The only brand I will use for my dog and cat! I refrigerate this after opening. I have to put in in a meatball of canned food as my dog hates anything fishy. But he will eat it that way. His coat is beautiriful. He sheds less, and most importantly it has helped with his immune system.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sch

customer_reviews.title: Dog really likes it
customer_reviews.text: This may be just placebo bias and adequate healing time, but having started my dog (female boxer) on these capsules, a previous intermittent limp (suspected osteoarthritis) appears to have disappeared. As a note, only omega-3's and NSAIDs (and surgery for shoulder OA) have any proven clinical benefit on osteoarthritis. The benefits of other supplements are at best debatable. So, if you are seeking additional OA management, these should work. Further, my dog enjoys the flavor enough that we can simply use them as treats. So giving the capsules is not a problem. However, these are not universally appreciated by all dogs in capsule form, as indicated by the rejection of the pill by a visiting dog.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Nordic Naturals Omega-3 Pet
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old Sheltie, adopted 2 years ago, responds very well to Nordic Naturals Omega-3 which my vet recommended. His mobility and coat has improved a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Carder

customer_reviews.title: Shiny coats!
customer_reviews.text: I home cook for my dogs and add this in at mealtimes. Flakey fur is gone and their coats are shiny and soft. Love that this product is tested thoroughly for heavy metals and other toxins.
customer_reviews.author: Sassys Mom

customer_reviews.title: They arrived quickly
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my little beagle mix to help with his arthritis. He also had elevated cholesterol levels. I just had him retested and his level went down. Still elevated but better. Not sure I see a difference yet in his arthritis but happy about his blood test.
customer_reviews.author: VK

customer_reviews.title: Great for the health of your dog!
customer_reviews.text: My bully has taken these since she was six months old. I just drop it in her dinner with some cottage cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Armijo

customer_reviews.title: Works for our Golden
customer_reviews.text: Our golden retriever was having some skin issues. Our vet recommended omega-3 for him. I read a bunch of reviews and finally decided on the Nordic Naturals Omega-3 Soft Gels. Our dog, who is 100 lbs. gets a couple of them per day. We put them in his food morning and evening. He does not mind eating them at all. His coat has greatly improved. He gets hot spots only once or twice per year, versus several times per year before omega-3. His fur is soft and he scratches very little. This product works for our pup!
customer_reviews.author: Principaled Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Fraudulent Product - Stay Away! 0 Stars.
customer_reviews.text: ABSOULTELY DO NOT ORDER THIS PRODUCT. The two bottles I ordered were 100% counterfeit as observed by the prior reviewer. God knows what I just gave my dogs or what are in these pills. The bottle's label has incorrect spelling on it. Absolutely fraudulent. Order direct from the Nordic Naturals supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stick together
customer_reviews.text: The pills have a tendency to stick together. On my last bottle, I took a gel-pack from an aspirin bottle and put it in with the Omega 3 pills. That helped to keep them from sticking together. I don't know why they don't come with this in the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: The ingredients
customer_reviews.text: It was packaged very nicely you can tell that it was new the only problem is that it made my dogs throw up they will not eat it so I can't give it to them you might want to check the ingredients before giving this to you animal
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Omega caps for your dog!
customer_reviews.text: My sister gives these to her senior dog and she eats them but sometimes spits up the outer skin/gel cap. Otherwise they are great!
customer_reviews.author: MARGARET GARCIA

customer_reviews.title: I poke each capsule to add to their food and the dogs love it. Not sure if I've noticed any changes ...
customer_reviews.text: Instructions say to feed it to a dog as-is, but neither of my dogs would eat them. They'd pop the capsule sometimes on the carpet but that's it. I poke each capsule to add to their food and the dogs love it. Not sure if I've noticed any changes to their mobility or coat regardless.
customer_reviews.author: ThePeter

customer_reviews.title: Great method for healing
customer_reviews.text: I open this and drip it on my dog's morning food, to aid in her healing process of osteoarthritis. Good Product to have for your pet's healing.
customer_reviews.author: DawnB

customer_reviews.title: Vet-Recommended Brand
customer_reviews.text: The vet prescribed fish oil for my dog's seborrhea and said that this was a very good brand. I am able to bury the soft gels in my dog's dry food and he gobbles them up with the food. The only problem is that now the vet has prescribed a higher dose of fish oil so i'm thinking it would be easier and more cost-effective to get it in liquid form that i can measure out and pour over his food.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie H

customer_reviews.title: Not messy and great for pet fur
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this. It's not as messy as the liquid . This is the secret to healthy fur on your pet!
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results.
customer_reviews.text: I have noticed a big difference in my pups. They don't like the pills so next time I'll just get the liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Tidd

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: I put a pin hole in and squeeze out. Not as good as pump bottle, but great ingredients!
customer_reviews.author: S. Lieb

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful coat!
customer_reviews.text: I've been giving this to my yellow lab for over a year and her coat is absolutely beautiful! I'm sure the other health benefits are there, too. :)
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Keeping my old guy in good health
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year-old bearded collie has been on this for years. I can't say that this is WHY he's so healthy, but I think it's part of it. He doesn't seem to have any joint issues and is the picture of health. I just drop one in his food morning and evening.
customer_reviews.author: SALAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Working and my basset loves eating them
customer_reviews.text: Bought these hoping to decrease the amount my dog sheds. I have a basset hound who was shedding so much, that I would have to vacuum every week. She's been taking them for about a month now, maybe more, and I have noticed she doesn't shed as much. I still vacuum every week, but only because of allergies, not the hair. She also loves them, and will eat it first before her food. Her skin still is a little dry, but that could be due to the season change.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: My dog was started on this product after undergoing bone/joint surgery. His surgeon gives this product to his dog daily. I have noticed that our dog healed quicker, he does not itch as much and loves this product on his food, capsule and all!!
customer_reviews.author: BK Souther

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: A little bit pricey but worth the money. It makes me shiba inu’s hair so soft. They still shed but their new coats are beautiful and shiny!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Fish Oil for Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly and as ordered. My dogs love it.
customer_reviews.author: Seandsand

customer_reviews.title: Really improved my dog's skin
customer_reviews.text: My dog has some sort of constant allergy where he gets itchy sores on his upper legs and extra dry, dandruff skin. My vet suggested omega-3s for him so I tried this. He no longer has sores or dandruff!! I tried another type of omega-3 and didn't get as great of results, so I would suggest this one specifically. He doesn't eat this as a gel tablet, so I have to puncture it and spread it over his food.
customer_reviews.author: E. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: the pills are too large for pill pockets
customer_reviews.text: The pills are too large for pill pockets and my dog spits out the pill and the oil gets all over. The pills can be made smaller, as is done for this type of vitamin for humans.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Melted solid chunk of pills
customer_reviews.text: Although I love this product and order it regularly - this shipment arrived melted into one solid chunk of fish oil pills and the bottom of the bottle was filled with loose fish oil. Completely unusable. Don't know how long the driver had these in his truck or if they were stored in a hot place? I suppose I need to refrain from ordering fish oil in the summer in AZ.
customer_reviews.author: Pet Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've been giving these to my greyhound. She came to us with dry skin and patches of missing hair. Her coat is shiny now and all of the hair has grown back.
customer_reviews.author: orbital99

customer_reviews.title: Works to make pet coat to become healtier!
customer_reviews.text: Scent is fish strong fish! Flavor I have no idea! But my dog coat starting to shine and her skin is becoming healthier!
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: When my 9 y/o Yorkie/Jack Russell terrier triglycerides became elevated to 800, my vet immediately recommended putting her on Omega 3. I read about the purity of Nordic Naturals and started her on them. Her triglycerides are now below 200! I did start her on a low fat, high protein dry food (Annamaet) which has helped with a 3lb. weight loss. She is now at 23 lbs- her normal wt.
customer_reviews.author: Fx Fixer

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes it.
customer_reviews.text: One a day for my dachshund. He had surgery for IVDD. Fish oil is good for lots of stuff anyway. Just poke it open and squirt it on his food... good to go. I'd say he looks forward to it, but he doesn't really speak english well. He'll be taking these for life.
customer_reviews.author: nothing

customer_reviews.title: An Essential for Pet Health
customer_reviews.text: We feed our dogs premium dog food, but during the winter months, their coats would still be flaky and dry. I purchased Nordic Naturals Omega-3 Pet, because I have used the Nordic Naturals for my family and am aware of their commitment to purity and quality in their products. Nordic Naturals uses molecularly-distilled wild anchovy and sardine oil. The cost of this bottle was LESS than a sub-quality product from my vets. This product is a staple for us now, since we've noticed a dramatic improvement in our dogs' coats and immune-responses.
customer_reviews.author: Upstate NY MOM

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These are the best value and my Boston terrier loves them. I put one in with her daily meal and she chews it up and swallows it down every time. I can even give her one by itself as a treat, surprisingly. I recommend these to anyone who cares enough for their pets health. My dogs coat is smooth and very shiny due in part to these supplements and the raw meat diet she has been on for years now. These pills help with any minor dry skin issues too. Thanks for a great product and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: vwo3

customer_reviews.title: Good pure product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dog because it was recommended by our vet to help with her dry skin and allergies. So far, it seems to be helping her to itch and shed less this Winter!
customer_reviews.author: BookWorm1984

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Our 14 year old fur baby is in stage 1 kidney failure. Our vet recommended this as part of her regiment. It helps her kidneys and her arthritis. Can't ask for more...
customer_reviews.author: JoS

customer_reviews.title: Hard as a rock
customer_reviews.text: wish it came whereby my dog could swallow whole..I need to stick a pin in it to get it spread over her phone and not always able to get all out..otherwise product works good
customer_reviews.author: honeybunny4989

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves taking these and I love giving them to her. She been on these vitamins for a little over three years and prior to taking them had really bad skin issues. She loves getting them in the morning , makes me happy knowing she's getting a pure and highly rate product. Don't ship them in the summer time if you love in Florida or a hot weather state, the pills will stick together.
customer_reviews.author: Lori G

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Switched to this omega 3 for my dogs a few weeks ago and so far they have no complaints :). I will purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Mikroulis

customer_reviews.title: Fish oil pills
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. Other places are more expensive with less inside
customer_reviews.author: stac crane

customer_reviews.title: Vegetarian - no fish oil smell
customer_reviews.text: Like everything about this product - no smell, no taste/after taste. Better than any other brand that have tried
customer_reviews.author: Nevada

customer_reviews.title: We have used this product for years for our dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Nordic Naturals Omega 3 pills for our dogs for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... a huge capsule but my small dog ate it like a champ
customer_reviews.text: this is a huge capsule but my small dog ate it like a champ, my big dog did not at first but started to. coat started to look and feel better. this is one ingredient that is totally needed for good coat.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good but expensive
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. I do think they are overpriced and am disappointed in the lack of discount on subscribe and save.
customer_reviews.author: Candy Zackowski

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I took these once and I didn’t burp fish so they must be good!!
customer_reviews.author: Edwina

customer_reviews.title: Love these soft gels
customer_reviews.text: Love these soft gels...well actually my dog loves them! She looks for these right after her dinner and sucks down the whole pill...lol. These do great for her coat and give her what she needs fatty acid wise. I've seen these elsewhere much more pricier. I will stick with this seller.
customer_reviews.author: sparky

customer_reviews.title: ... this product for ten years for my dog and love it. I always suggest that you use UPS ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for ten years for my dog and love it. I always suggest that you use UPS to ship because the USPS does not implement safety/security measures to make sure the package is not a temptation to those passing along down the street.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Pills are good.
customer_reviews.text: Well, my dog gets two of these per day and so far, so good. I don't notice a real difference in her since I think it's too soon but, I'll stay with it till the bottle is gone and in the mean time, I'm assuming it's doing her good. I puncture the pill and squeeze out the oil very easily without any mess and it doesn't smell strong. She eats it up without hesitation. I'm happy with this product as it does seem like high quality stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Looloo

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Poor packaging.
customer_reviews.text: The product is amazing when I purchase from the veterinarian's office. Unfortunately I purchased this one on Amazon for my mom's dog and all the pills came clumped together. She had to use a knife to cut the bottle open. Pills were still fine to use once pulled apart.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa douglas

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My dog does not like the taste but eats it with his food. This product definitely works. Older active dogs need this
customer_reviews.author: jeff sushko

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Quality
customer_reviews.text: Pills are great, no fishy smell. Noticable differences in my itchy baby. Will continue to buy!
customer_reviews.author: NurseRN81

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This brand is awesome!! My two dogs no longer have dried paws and their fur looks and feels shiny and soft. I believe their overall health has improved as well. I since have switched to the liquid in the same brand, as these capsules are rather large and I got tired of breaking the capsules open and putting it on their food. Definitely recommend Nordic Naturals and will continue to purchase their products!!
customer_reviews.author: Takeetah

customer_reviews.title: Okay Fish Oil Capsule
customer_reviews.text: Very large capsule for small dogs and very strong odor. Nonetheless my mini-Schnauzer is able to get it down in a pill pocket.
customer_reviews.author: tigglynn

customer_reviews.title: Great, great product for our four legged companions
customer_reviews.text: My 10 1/2 year old Springer has taken 4 of these a day with the advise of our vet for the last 6 months to ease arthritis in her knees. We saw a difference in her mobility within a couple of weeks. She was struggling to manage the stairs and now is bounding up and down as if she were 3 years old again. Great, great product for our four legged companions.
customer_reviews.author: WenMak

customer_reviews.title: love this!
customer_reviews.text: so my dog had really dry coat. her skin was flaky and had dandruff. since i have been giving her this every other day (she weighs approx 15lbs), the flaky skin is barely there and her fur became softer. definitely improved her skin and coat. love this!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: ?change of formula
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for our dog for quite a long time and she always ate them. This last bottle we got recently must have something wrong or they have changed the formula because she will eat all around them and leave them no matter how we try to disguise them. Unfortunately I have to throw out a practically full bottle.At this point I cannot rate as high as I would like to have and would have in the past.
customer_reviews.author: deemac

customer_reviews.title: I can just toss this at my Dogbert and he ...
customer_reviews.text: I can just toss this at my Dogbert and he eats it, no problem. Seems to be helping with the jacked up skin between his paws.
customer_reviews.author: Z Man Dude

product_meta.title: Nordic Naturals Omega 3 Pet - Special Dog Formula Fish Oil Omega-3s, EPA, DHA Supports Skin, Coat, Joint, Heart and Overall Health in Triglyceride Form for Optimal Absorption
feature_bullets: YOUR DOG DESERVES THE BEST: All Nordic Naturals pet products are made with the same exceptional quality oil as our human products, but have been specially formulated for dogs. Please use only our pet products for your dog or cat, not our human products.

OPTIMAL HEALTH + WELLNESS: Nordic Naturals Omega-3 Pet products are an excellent source of the important omega-3 fatty acids EPA and DHA. EPA and DHA help support skin and coat health, joint health, heart health, immune system health, cellular health, and brain and eye development and maintenance. Available in liquid or soft gels.

PROACTIVE PROTECTION FOR YOUR PUP: Daily supplementation with Omega-3 Pet products is a proactive way to help support overall health for your pet companions. Omega-3 Pet provides dogs and cats with what they need to keep feeling and looking their best!

WILD CAUGHT and SUSTAINABLY SOURCED: Every batch of Nordic Naturals fish oil is crafted from wild-caught, omega-rich fish from the freshest catch, sourced from the cleanest waters, and only in a way that fully protects the ocean’s fragile ecosystem.

BEST ABSORPTION FOR BEST RESULTS: Many concentrated fish oils on the market are in the ethyl ester molecular form—a synthetic fat with only about 30 years of history in the human diet. Nordic Naturals formulas are produced in true triglyceride form to ensure optimal absorption and results.
